subject: Leadership
title: Accountability Starts at the Top
description: A fast breakdown of Accountability Starts at the Top for builders.

hook.text: When things go wrong, the leader says 'That's on me.' When things go right, she says 'That's the team.'

buildup.text: Accountability means owning outcomesâ€”good and bad. Leaders who blame others erode trust instantly.

discovery.text: Jocko Willink's 'Extreme Ownership' principle: there are no bad teams, only bad leaders who fail to take responsibility.

twist.text: Accountability isn't about punishment. It's about creating a culture where everyone owns their part of the outcome.

climax.text: When leaders model accountability, teams mirror it. The culture shifts from blame to problem-solving.

punchline.text: Own the failures. Share the wins. That's how leaders build trust.

quiz.question: What is the core idea of 'Extreme Ownership'?
options: Leaders take responsibility for all outcomes
